subject: Re: How to test main() method ??
msgSnippet: Thanks David. How are the static methods tested? (its my first few days into JUnit and I am yet to write test for a static method). My main method asks the
messageBody:
Thanks David. How are the static methods tested? (its my first few
days into JUnit and I am yet to write test for a static method). My
main method asks the user to enter 0-4. As you might have guessed it
by now, in the body it has a switch statement. The switch based on
whether the input was 0-4, calls upon some method from a different class.



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Jackman" <david.jackman@f...> wrote:
> If your main is simply instantiating an object and calling a method on
> it, then it may not need to be tested. If it has any logic at all, it
> should be tested. You can test this method just like testing any other
> static method. If your main reads from stdin and writes to stdout then
> you will want to override these streams in your tests so you can control
> the input and verify the output.
>
> ..David..
>
>
> ________________________________
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> xll_ll_ll_ll_ll_llx
> Sent: Friday, September 16, 2005 12:26 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] How to test main() method ??
>
>
> I need info on how to go about testing the main() method. Should it
> really be tested? If yes, what are the various ways in which this can
> be done?
> Where can I find more resources (preferrably online) on this issue?
>
> Thanks.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
